question: My husband grew up a perfectly healthy man. He has always been very athletic. While playing college football, he broke his shoulder. He was taken to the hosptal, where he had surgery the next day.  After his release he became very ill. He was rushed to the hospital almost in a coma, where he was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes. He doesn't have a family history of diabetes and has never had any health problems. Could his diabetes be caused from the surgery or any medications used during?
title: Surgery induced diabetes type 1
